trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Command" name="Command" href=""></xref> event.

The `Command` event is raised when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control button in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerField> object is clicked.

The DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs class is used internally by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.OnBubbleEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatePagerField.HandleEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> methods to access information about the event that was raised.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs class, see the DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs constructor.
For more information about how to handle events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is primarily used by control developers when raising events.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagePropertiesChangingEventArgs> class.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs.Item%2A>|The value of the `item` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A>|The value of the `commandSource` parameter.|
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem"></xref> object that generated the event.
The source of the event.
The original event data that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName*> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandArgument*> properties.
Gets the control that raised the event.
The control that raised the event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem"></xref> object that contains the control that raised the event.
Use the Item property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem.PagerField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property represents the pager field object that contains the control that raised the event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem.Pager%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property represents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPagerFieldItem"></xref> object that contains the control that raised the event.
